snippet: BP has argued that a judge had misinterpreted settlement terms in ways that would force it to pay for billions of dollars in inflated or false claims by businesses.
abstract: Federal appeals court upholds Judge Carl Barbier of Federal District Court's approval of company's multi-billion-dollar settlement with lawyers for businesses and residents who claim 2010 oil spill in Gulf of Mexico cost them money; BP has argued that judge had misinterpreted settlement terms in ways that would force it to pay for billions of dollars in inflated or false claims.
lead_paragraph: BP has argued that a judge had misinterpreted settlement terms in ways that would force it to pay for billions of dollars in inflated or false claims by businesses.

headline.main: Appeals Court Upholds BP Oil Spill Settlement
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Upholds Oil Spill Settlement
